p:
A proportion ρ
c,i of latent index cases individuals in E
i progress to the symptomatic infectious class I
i at the rate
κ while the rest (1 − ρ
c,i ) progress to asymptomatic and non-infectious class A
i at the same rate
κ . Only the symptomatic cases are observed. Symptomatic index infectious individuals I
i are hospitalized at the average rate γ
a or recover without being hospitalized at the average rate γ
I,i Similarly, a fraction ρ
c,s of secondary cases in E
s progress to the symptomatic class I
s at the rate
κ while the rest (1 − ρ
c,s ) progress to asymptomatic and non-infectious class A s at the same rate
κ . Symptomatic secondary infectious I
s -individuals are hospitalized at average rate γ
a or recover without being hospitalized at average rate γ
I,s . Individuals in the “removed” class do not contribute to the transmission process.
